        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

        args - Command-line arguments, with which nothing is done.

      • getCurrentServerUptime

        public int[] getCurrentServerUptime()
        This method will return the time in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, since the server was started OR since it was last reloaded.
        Returns:
        An array of ints, i, where:
          i[0] is the seconds,
          i[1] is the minutes,
          i[2] is the hours,
          i[3] is the days,
        that the server has been online without reloading.

      • getMemory

        public double[] getMemory()
        Gets the current memory used, maxmimum memory, memory free, and percentage of memory free. Returned in a single array of doubles.
        Returns:
        memory[], which is an array of doubles, containing four values, where:
        memory[0] is the currently used memory;
        memory[1] is the current maximum memory;
        memory[2] is the current free memory;
        memory[3] is the percentage memory free (note this may be an irrational number, so you might want to truncate it if you use this).
        Since:
        1.11.0-SNAPSHOT

      • getMemoryCommand

        public java.lang.String getMemoryCommand()

        Returns:
        The memory notification command.

      • getMemoryNotificationThreshold

        public float getMemoryNotificationThreshold()
        The memory notification theshold is the point at which LagMeter will notify its observers that the memory free has dropped below this amount.
        Returns:
        The memory notification theshold.

      • parseTime

        public long parseTime(java.lang.String timeString)
               throws InvalidTimeFormatException
        Parses a string to get the amount of ticks equal to what the string passed represents.
        Parameters:
        timeString - - The "human-readable" representation of time, where:
          s is seconds;
          m is minutes;
          h is hours;
          d is days; and finally,
          w is weeks.
        Returns:
        Amount of ticks which corresponds to this string of time.
        Throws:
        InvalidTimeFormatException - If the time format given is invalid or the tick amount which results is less than 1
        See Also:
        parseTimeMS(String)

      • parseTimeMS

        public long parseTimeMS(java.lang.String timeString)
                 throws InvalidTimeFormatException
        Parses the timeString given and returns milliseconds instead of ticks. Works in the same fashion as parseTime(String).
        Parameters:
        timeString - - The string of time, where:
          s is seconds;
          m is minutes;
          h is hours;
          d is days; and finally,
          w is weeks.
        Returns:
        The amount of milliseconds that would equate to the time string given.
        Throws:
        InvalidTimeFormatException - If the timeString is in an invalid format (i.e. invalid characters) or the result is less than 1.
        See Also:
        parseTime(String)

      • ping

        public void ping(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
        java.lang.String[] args)
        This method pings google.com, telling the player what the result is.
        Parameters:
        sender - - The CommandSender object to output to.
        args -
          [0]: hops

      • registerAsyncLagListener

        public int registerAsyncLagListener(LagListener listener)
        Registers a listener for when LagMeter finds that the server's TPS has dropped below the user's specified threshold for the event to be fired. When this happens, the event method in the class which implements LagListener will be run. Code will be executed asynchronously in a new thread; therefore, only thread-safe code should be used.
        Parameters:
        listener - - The listener which implements LagListener which should be notified of the event when (if) it happens.
        Returns:
        The ID of the listener in LagMeter's allocated memory. This is used to cancel the registration of the listener, etc.

      • registerAsyncMemoryListener

        public int registerAsyncMemoryListener(MemoryListener listener)
        Registers a listener for when LagMeter finds that the free memory has dropped below the user's specified threshold for the evnt to be fired. When this happens, the event method in the class which implements MemoryListener will be run. Code will be executed asynchronously; therefore, only thread-safe code should be produced.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener which implements MemoryListener which should be notified of the event when (if) it happens.
        Returns:
        The ID of the listener in LagMeter's allocated memory. This is used to cancel the registration of the listener, etc.

      • registerSyncLagListener

        public int registerSyncLagListener(LagListener listener)
        Registers a listener for when LagMeter finds that the server's TPS has dropped below the user's specified threshold for the event to be fired. When this happens, the event method in the class which implements LagListener will be run. Code will be executed synchronously, with the main server thread; therefore, thread-unsafe code may be used.
        Parameters:
        listener - - The listener which implements LagListener which should be notified of the event when (if) it happens.
        Returns:
        The ID of the listener in LagMeter's allocated memory. This is used to cancel the registration of the listener, etc.

      • registerSyncMemoryListener

        public int registerSyncMemoryListener(MemoryListener listener)
        Registers a listener for when LagMeter finds that the free memory has dropped below the user's specified threshold for the evnt to be fired. When this happens, the event method in the class which implements MemoryListener will be run. Code will be executed synchronously, with the main server thread; therefore, thread-unsafe methods and code may be used.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener which implements MemoryListener which should be notified of the event when (if) it happens.
        Returns:
        The ID of the listener in LagMeter's allocated memory. This is used to cancel the registration of the listener, etc.

      • sendLagMeter

        public void sendLagMeter(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
        Sends the original purpose of this plugin, the Lag Meter, to the specified CommandSender.
        Parameters:
        sender - The CommandSender to send the LagMeter to.

      • sendMemMeter

        public void sendMemMeter(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
        This sends the other original function of this plugin, the memory meter, to the specified ConsoleSender.
        Parameters:
        sender - - The ConsoleSender object to send the memory meter to.
